headline: Blueberry Buckle
description: This blueberry buckle is a tender, made-from-scratch coffee cake studded with fresh blueberries and topped with a buttery, crumbly cinnamon streusel.
name: Blueberry Buckle

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease an 8x8-inch pan.

Cream sugar, shortening, and egg in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Stir together flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture to sugar mixture in 2 batches, alternating with milk, beating batter briefly after each addition. Fold in blueberries. Pour into the prepared pan.
Make topping: Combine sugar, flour, butter, and cinnamon in a bowl; mix with your hands until crumbly. Sprinkle over cake batter.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: was so simple and quick to make. Used this recipe before, very good

I love this dish. I follow the recipe exactly unless I happen to have buttermilk on hand. It’s great for days I feel like making something other than muffins. I only gave it 4 stars because it always takes 45-50 minutes to cook not 25-30 no matter what oven I’m cooking this in.

As others have noted, despite following this recipe to the letter, I find that I consistently have to double or triple the cooking times. This time around it took an hour in a preheated oven in a glass 8x8 dish with fresh blueberries. However, it’s now my go-to for family gatherings at the holidays and is loved by everyone, including the notoriously difficult in-laws, so no complaints here! Balanced, delicious and (warning: here comes that word that some people have been rallying against in recent years) MOIST. Just nom. I’m making it again right now. Nom nom.

This was so easy to make and absolutely delicious. The only change I made was to use butter instead of shortening. I also tossed the berries in sugar before folding them into the batter. I used half brown sugar/half white sugar in the crumb topping.
Thanks to the member who shared this recipe. We really enjoyed this recipe on many occasions. In my oven, I have increased the baking time to 40 minutes.
I made this recipe when my brother came home and used frozen blueberries instead of fresh. I had to double the cooking time. My family loved this recipe. Will definitely make again.

Needed to cook 10-15 minutes longer than noted and I used a 9” Pyrex pie plate. Added vanilla with the milk, added extra blueberries on top and half brown sugar in the topping. It was nice and moist. Definitely will make this again.

I added a bit more blueberries after making it as the recipe called for the first time. I dropped the temperature 25 and increased the time to almost an hour. My first, exactly as written took about 45 minutes.

I made this exactly as written and it turned out perfectly and came together surprisingly fast. It did take 15-20 minutes longer in the oven but was not burnt at all around the edges or raw in the middle, as another reviewer stated. I'll definitely be making this again soon!
Perfect recipe!
I also used 1/2 brown sugar on the topping to cut down on the white sugar
It took a bit longer to cook through in the center. Delish, just like Mom’s.
Excellent, I am glad I tried it. Will definitely make it more often. Easy to assemble, lovely and fruity. Served with ice-cream it will become a family favorite.

I would love to know how anyone “poured” this into the baking dish! Two cups of flour with only a half cup of milk makes paste. I increased the milk until I had a thick batter. Then scraped it into the dish. It took twice as long to bake as the directions indicated. But in the end, it was glorious! I will keep adjusting this recipe to make it work better because I love the flavor.
Followed it exactly, using wild blueberries we just foraged, and it is perfect and delicious! Ate a piece for breakfast, but could also be dessert!
It is delicious! I used a little less blueberries and left it in the oven for 35 minutes. I think it could of baked an additional 5 minutes. The center looks a little wet. Over all, it's very good.
I have been making blueberry buckle forever, this was the best.

I thought this buckle was very moist and delicious (using an instant read thermometer to test for doneness (205-200 F) really helps). However, I kept thinking it was missing something. Afterwards, I realized it needed vanilla extract and some lemon zest to elevate the flavors and create some depth. Next time, I would try 1 tsp of pure vanilla extract and 1 tsp lemon zest and see if that’s enough or will it need additional tweaking. With these adjustments I’m sure it would raise my rating to 5 stars!
It’s very flavorful. I made it twice and couldn’t wait to sample a small piece.
I made it as directed. It was wonderful but it was undercooked in the middle. Next time I will cook it a little longer. This may be my oven

I make this recipe all the time. Love it and so do my guest. People ask me to make this for them. I do exactly as the directions say and it turns out great every time. So I have no idea what the problem is with some of the reviews. Hope this helps!
Yummy exactly as is! I have made muffins using this too. No changes necessary.
The cake was moist and the topping sweet and crunchy. The blueberries were pockets of flavor.
Cool
This is absolutely addictive!
Easy and moist-so good. I used a 9 x 11 pan so the cooking time was perfect. I’ll definitely make this again.
This recipe is just like the one I have from my mom! We always double the recipe so there's enough for everyone. I just made it yesterday and am expecting my daughter to stop by anytime.

I followed the recipe exactly and wish I hadn't followed it at all. Everything was fine until I added the blueberries: it was like stirring hardening cement. The end result was nothing special; my wife and two sons were indifferent.
Very yummy! Had to cook it longer than stated but came out great. Love fresh blueberry season!

Easy to make and tasted amazing!
Big hit with the entire family!
I did find however that it took about 45 minutes to bake instead of the 25-30min in the recipe.

I followed all of COOKIEQUEEN recommendations for ingredients, but I should have followed the baking instructions. The middle was not cooked and sunk, and all around it was dry and crumbly (the topping and the cake). It was delicious and I will keep this recipe and try 45 minutes or a 9x9 pan for 30 minutes.
I used butter instead of shortening but wouldnt change another thing
Great, simple recipe. We will make it again!
Was wonderful! Made for breakfast this morning. Only change was to add about 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla. Used butter instead of shortening. Will definitely make again!
I will make again. Very good.

I did add a little bit of brown sugar to the topping. This cake I named “Scooters blueberry buckel cake.l named it after my younger brother Scooter as he is in the hospital again the 2nd time for brain cancer. It’s very aggressive. This time the tumor is bigger then the last time. I am crushed. My brother just smiled and he pretends it’s all ok so I pretend. Pray for him and thank you for his delishish cake.
really good!
It was good. Maybe my oven temp was off, but the middle of my dark pan was still like batter at 25 min. At 30 minutes it wasn’t much more done. Maybe a 9 inch pan would have baked more evenly.

Great recipe. Followed the same measurements, would not change that. I discovered upon assembling the batter I had no shortening, so I used coconut oil. The bake time of 375 degrees for 25-30 is definitely an error. I baked this for 50-55 minutes at the same temperature for the best result. Also used fresh blueberries tossed in a tablespoon of flour.
Absolutely delicious. Didn’t make any changes to the recipe. This will be my go to blueberry buckle recipe!!
Recipe was delicious exactly as written. Perfect to make after a day of blueberry picking- yummy!
It was quite dry and took about 15 minutes more to cook. Maybe another egg? More milk? a larger pan? I don't know....it has potential but might look elsewhere next time
Made it just like the recipe says. It taste amazing and all my family ate it right up. Definitely will be making this again?
I didn't make any changes because it was perfect, everybody loved it, next time I might try mixed berries that sounds good to me!!
I have made this several times especially during blueberry season. I make it exactly as written. I usually double it and use a 9x13 pan (add about 5 minutes additional bake time).
Yum, smells amazing and pretty easy too ?? the batter is like the in between of bread and cake.
Amazing!!! I never make any changes to the recipe and it’s always perfect!

This was an great recipe. Had blueberries I needed to use and found this recipe. Followed it exactly. Didn’t change anything except the baking time. It was not done in 30 mins, I had to put it back in for another 10. But it was delicious.

It was good, very much like a giant blueberry muffin, but in an 8x8 pan, there is NO WAY this could be done within 30 mins! I followed everything to a T, and it took close to an hour to be cooked through.
I started making this recipe in my DASH mini waffles maker. OMG!!!! They are awesome!!!
I didn’t change a thing! It was so juicy and delicious, perfect for mid morning, afternoon, or as a dessert or just about anytime!

Wonderful, follow the directions you can't go wrong. The only problem I encountered was when I added the blueberries, they were still wet from washing, consequently it seemed the cake while baking was continually wet having liquid on the top. As a result I had to bake it almost 20 minutes longer for it to be completely dry and starting to brown. 
Anyway, the end result was perfect. pictured here.

I love the blueberry version so much I tried it with some canned peaches I had on hand. Yum. Great with ice cream on the side. I strained 1 can of peaches and chopped them, used half milk and half the strained peach juices for liquid in the buckle. I also added chopped pecans to the crumble on top. My family highly approved.
Really good. I had 3 workmen here the day I made it. I sent them home with some. One guy texted me the next day asking for the recipe!

I followed the recipe exactly as written; even double checked twice. But it was like cookie dough. So I added a quarter cup of half and half which loosened it up enough that I felt comfortable it would bake evenly and thoroughly. Came out nice and very good!
Delicious. Tastes like a moist blueberry muffin.
I was given some fresh blueberries and searched for recipe to use them. Came upon this gem!!! Didn’t alleviate from recipe at all and it was PERFECT!!! So easy and so freaking delicious!!

This is a great recipe for Blueberry Buckle. I made it exactly as written with only one exception. I did add 1/4 tsp vanilla. The blueberries did not sink since the batter was thick like it should be. Bottom line, don't go messing with this recipe!
Easy recipe and so delicious! Moist and flavorful, like a cake and a cobbler had a baby. Will definitely make again!
Using fresh blueberries made it tastes so homemade.

For those who get fussed about 5 stars with edits to the recipe, the recipe as is works nicely so no worries! I have some tips that I like to do for those who want it 
1. As others have said do not reduce flour. Watch how you measure it. If you scoop with the measuring cup you are probably using too much flour as it compresses. Use a spoon to fill the cup and then level it. The recipe says to pour the batter which may be misleading. This is supposed to be a thick batter that needs to be spread into the dish. It has the consistency of peanut butter. This is why it is a buckle. It also won't rise as much as a cake. It is dense and moist.

2. A trick to make a nice crunchy topping for any recipe,
. Make the topping first. When blended into the pea sized crumbles, press it up against the sides of a glass or metal bowl and put in fridge. When rest of cake is ready , use a fork to break topping away from bowl sides and re crumble. Handle as little as possible to keep it cool. Sprinkle on cake as directed. I personally prefer 50-50 brown and white sugar.

3. Cream your shortening and sugar first and very well. The batter should be light and fluffy and the sugar a bit broken down (eg can't see crystals of it). It will take a few minutes high speed, scraping the bowl down 2 or 3 times. Then beat in egg. I use 50-50 butter and shortening as I prefer how it blends and like the butter taste. I also add 1 tsp good vanilla and beat it in after the egg.

4. Takes 40 min cooking time
East and delicious. Worked well with frozen blueberries.

The "cake" came out well. The poker guys really enjoyed it. However, in the future, I would make my typical topping that I put on a Dutch apple pie. It think it would come out much more flavorful. I believe the lack of brown sugar is the problem. Overall, a good recipe.

I love when I see a recipe with 5 stars. It screams, "You will LOVE this!!" This was absolutely true here. It has a lot of ingredients but it was very easy to put together. Don't be afraid if the batter is very thick and you have to press it into the pan. Also, the amount of topping is necessary as it adds just the right amount of sweetness! We ate it for dessert, as coffee cake and snuck pieces because we could. Highly recommended!!
I got distracted and mixed the topping into the batter by mistake. It still came out worthy of 5 stars!

I love this recipe! It is moist and delicious and tastes like the best blueberry muffin you’ve ever had. I use this recipe for muffins as well as cake, and it’s magical. Add some cranberries and apples, and you’ve got a brunch crowd pleaser.

Made as written. As others have said, batter was thick and needed to be patted in pan. Because of this, I put in 1/2 batter, blueberries which I then pressed into batter, remaining drops of batter, and then crumb topping. It's a relatively light bread/cake, well balanced with berries but not exciting given the cost of blueberries.
I made this almost exactly as written (I will not use shortening, so I replaced with butter), and they turned out amazing. My entire family loved them and are already asking me to make more.
Awesome - best blueberry buckle recipe!
I doubled the recipe but folded in 3 cups of blueberries. After 30 min of baking I placed aluminum foil over it to prevent burning the top. ?

We loved this!! It’s fast, easy & great for breakfast and/or dessert. I had never had a “buckle” before so I tried it. I followed the recipe exactly, but mistakenly set the oven at 400 degrees for my next recipe!!! I realized my mistake & frantically removed it from the oven after 42 minutes and it still came out great!!! I will definitely make this again (at the correct temperature next time!!!).
“The best cake you’ve ever made” was the comment from Hubby. This was delicious. I’m glad I read the reviews about the batter being stiff or I would have worried. Fear not!
Excellent
The flavor is good, but the topping isn’t “crumbly”. It was pretty dry. I’m not sure if I would make it again.
We’ve made this twice now. It is easy and delicious! Our son asked if he can eat the whole thing!
Perfect!!!! And delicious!!
Made exactly as recipe outlined with one exception. I increased cinnamon to 2 teaspoons. Delicious and super easy to make.
Rave reviews!!! Didn't change a thing.

Good recipe, but the cake was a bit bland. I made some adjustments the second time I made it...
Up sugar in cake to 1 cup
Add 1 tsp vanilla to the batter
Rather than mix in blueberries, put batter in the pan, sprinkle with blueberries and press them gently into the batter
Use brown sugar instead of white in the streusel
Add 1/3 c oats

Made it very close to recipe. I added 1tsp of vanilla to the batter, and didn’t use cinnamon in the crumb. It does take longer to bake, for me around 50 mins. It is a very light crumb, many berries, and pretty sweet. I love it.
Had to bake it an extra 13 min.
What a lovely cake! This blueberry dessert
30 minutes is way too short. If cooking in a glass pan, you need to cook this baby closer to 45 minutes.

I love this blueberry cake! I followed the directions to a T and all is well in the taste department. My only issue was how long to bake it. The first time I made it, it was not cooked in the center. The second time to made it, I baked it for 15 minutes longer. I started at 375 for 35 minutes then did the last 10 at 350. Still tweaking this recipe for baking time and temp but tastes great!
Absolutely delicious!!! This will make a great desert or morning coffee cake.

Everything about this recipe is spot on good! Nothing needs to be changed. I had to bake mine a little longer (could be my old oven). Other than that, it turned out excellent. After it cooled, I added a simple icing to the top (wisk: 1 1/2 Tbsp melted butter,
1 cup powdered sugar
1 1/2 Tbsp half and half, then more if needed
1/4 tsp vanilla extract
1/8 tsp almond extract).

Made this for a quarantine snack and it was a huge hit. Only changed shortening to butter, because it's what I had, but otherwise filled the recipe exactly (except I doubled it.) 24 hours later and it's almost gone. Everyone loved it.

I never write reviews but this is the best recipe I've ever made from AllRecipes. We could have eaten the whole thing at one sitting. I made it exactly as written except for coating the blueberries in flour before mixing them in. I used frozen blueberries from my own bushes and it was delicious and perfect.

I didn’t see the many reviews that recommended only using 1 1/2 C flour, so I found it to be rather doughy and thick when mixing. I had to add a couple splashes more milk to get it to a better consistency. Everything else was the same. It did take much longer to bake than listed, not sure if that was because I had more milk in there, but mine took about 10-15 more minutes to cook through. Very tasty. It does just taste like a blueberry muffin to me, with a streusel topping.
Amazing!! So moist and delicious!
I made the recipe with frozen blueberries and it was very moist and delicious, looking forward to making it again soon!

This turned out better then I expected. Very good. Will be making this again. Husband doesn’t like blueberries but ate this up. I did use butter instead of shortening. And added a tablespoon of vanilla extract.

This turned out better then I expected. Very good. Will be making this again. Husband doesn’t like blueberries but ate this up. I did use butter instead of shortening. And added a tablespoon of vanilla extract.
Delicious & easy
I finally got to make this yesterday. I followed the recipe exactly, but for some reason it came out bland. No real “sweet” taste at all. Definitely needs more sugar.
I made it according to directions and it was fantastic. The only thing that needed to be adjusted was the time. Took almost 45 minutes to brown on top. Great recipe.
I wish I could give this 10 stars. This is the best desert ever. It’s more like a bread but so delicious! Everyone loved it. So tasty and just enough sweetness.

Made as written. Dough very stiff, will make again soon with 1.5 flout and add vanilla also. Used frozen blueberries dusted with flour. Live at high altitude and at 25 min. Raw...cooked additional 35 min. Believe it was due to heavy batter.
One of my favorite breakfast items. Followed recipe only added sanding sugar on top. Everyone loved it.
